column4: Latest;Phnom Penh:------ The Forestry Administration’s Wildlife Crime Prevention Task Force
column5: in cooperation with the Royal Gendarmerie  visited a store selling sculptures and trinkets on November 12
column10: Khan Chbar Ampov.------The owner was named as Mok Tip Raisi
column13: police found wildlife parts including elephant ivory
column14: a number of other teeth and bones from endangered animals such as tigers
column15: along with other materials. All wildlife samples exhibited and sold without authorization from the Forestry Administration have been temporarily withdrawn and the case will be sent to the court to decide legal action.------https://tvfb.news/article/15958------
